  > "My 1/50 of a unit of United States Federally-Issued currency. :-)"
Whi=
ch unit? :)

Seriously though, I agree with Simon.  However, if this state =
is
necessary to be known to other objects I would suggest that the
initiali=
ze not be in the constructor.  If other objects must know about
it's state,=
 it's better to have those objects call the initialize()
themselves.  On th=
e other hand, I don't think the internal state of an
object should be publi=
cized, as a general rule.  So that might suggest
that you provide better ex=
ception handling instead (or in addition to)
the "newing" of an object.

-j=
ason

There is a s=
chool of thought that an object's API should never allow
it's internal stat=
e to be made unstable/invalid/partially-updated. I
would vote for doing wha=
tever it takes to ensure that the initial state
is valid and then use unit =
tests to ensure that it stays that way.

My 1/50 of a unit of United States=
 Federally-Issued currency. :-)
